items.sentence: I guess I don\'t understand what you\'re trying to say.
If I hadn\'t wanted to be there, I wouldn\'t have gone.
If Tom didn\'t want to be here, he wouldn\'t have come.
There\'s a small possibility that Tom will be arrested.
Are you telling me Tom doesn\'t live in Boston anymore?
I was just wondering if you\'d heard anything from Tom.
I can\'t believe I\'m stuck here in this room with you.
Tom can play the guitar and he\'s good at singing, too.
Tom can\'t remember exactly what he was supposed to do.
I tried to talk Tom out of it, but he wouldn\'t listen.
Tom looks like he got dressed in the dark this morning.
Tom loves to drink tea from the cup that Mary gave him.
Can you remember when the first time you came here was?
Can you see anything that might be causing the problem?
Tom has been living in Boston for the past three years.
Tom has been married to Mary for just over three years.
Tom has been seeing a therapist for a month and a half.
Tom has been sitting in that room alone for five hours.
Tom has enough money to buy everything he really needs.
Tom has enough money to buy everything he really wants.
I doubt seriously that it was Tom who broke the window.
Mary told Tom she didn\'t want him to date other women.
Mary told me that she didn\'t love her husband anymore.
Mary\'s closet is full of clothes that she never wears.
Tom wanted me to keep it quiet until he talked to Mary.
Tom wanted to give Mary some earrings for her birthday.
I ran as fast as I could in order to catch up with Tom.
We\'ve accomplished almost everything we set out to do.
What makes you so sure that Tom won\'t be here tonight?
You don\'t really think Tom tried to cheat you, do you?
One of us will have to drive over and see Tom tomorrow.
Tom smiled when he realized Mary was about to kiss him.
Tom speaks French as well as anybody else in this room.
Tom hugged Mary tightly and never wanted to let her go.
Tom is better at science than anyone else in his class.
Tom won\'t be here tomorrow. I guarantee you that much.
Tom doesn\'t want to buy anything for Mary\'s birthday.
Tom lives within walking distance of the train station.
Tom locked himself in his room and refused to come out.
Tom might go to the zoo with Mary this coming Saturday.
Tom seemed surprised when I told him Mary wasn\'t here.
I owed Tom some money for some things he bought for me.
Tom died three days before he was to receive the award.
There\'s someone I have to get in touch with in Boston.
Today\'s paper says that another typhoon is on its way.
Tom usually doesn\'t have to work on Monday afternoons.
If I remember correctly, Tom\'s birthday is in October.
Tom says I don\'t need to go there if I don\'t want to.
Tom says he can\'t remember his French teacher\'s name.
I knew I shouldn\'t have done it, but I did it anyways.
I thought going out to eat together would cheer you up.
I don\'t think that it\'s going to be easy to find Tom.
I don\'t want to tell Tom that I\'ve been to Australia.
Does Tom really think he can convince Mary to help him?
Does the price of the room include the service charges?
The police have given up looking for the missing child.
Some students aren\'t going to come back next semester.
Tom said that he didn\'t really like working in Boston.
Do you think there\'s really a monster in the basement?
It\'s not a good idea to let children play with knives.
It\'s your money. You can do whatever you want with it.
Nowadays it isn\'t unusual for a woman to travel alone.
I suspect Tom and Mary are planning on eating together.
I suspect that Tom did that just to get some attention.
I suspect that Tom needs to do that sometime this week.
I think Boston is the most beautiful city in the world.
It\'s not that I don\'t want to go, I can\'t afford to.
Tom can\'t swim. However, he is a good baseball player.
I just don\'t understand why Tom would want to do that.
It could take years before this bridge is ready to use.
I just learned that Tom won\'t be at the meeting today.
This question can\'t be answered by a simple yes or no.
Tom is wearing those gloves you gave him for Christmas.
Tom is wearing what appears to be some kind of uniform.
Tom can play the piano better than anybody else I know.
There\'s not enough room in here for both Tom and Mary.
I wonder whether or not Tom and Mary will get divorced.
I wonder whether or not Tom can babysit for us tonight.
I wonder whether or not Tom really intended to do that.
Tom thought that Mary didn\'t know how to speak French.
Would you tell Tom why you don\'t want Mary to do that?
Yelling and screaming isn\'t going to get you anywhere.
Tom is the one who took the bandage off of Mary\'s arm.
Tom spent all his money to buy Mary a birthday present.
I would\'ve talked to Tom instead of just ignoring him.
I\'d really like to know why he did that sort of thing.
Tom wrote to Mary to tell her what had happened to him.
You\'re never going to find another man as good as Tom.
You\'re the best French speaker in our office, I think.
You\'re the only one here who thinks Tom is a nice guy.
I didn\'t have enough space to fit my lunch in the bag.
I\'m not surprised to hear that Tom doesn\'t like Mary.
Tom seems to hardly ever get his homework done on time.
Tom staggered out of the bar with a bottle in his hand.
Tom can\'t afford the kind of rent they\'re asking for.
Tom looked everywhere for Mary, but couldn\'t find her.
Tom looked into the classroom, but he didn\'t see Mary.
If you pick up the velvet, you can feel how soft it is.
If you wait a while, your eyes will adjust to the dark.
Are you planning to go to Boston with Tom next weekend?
